Bash(git commit -m "$\(cat <<''EOF''
feat: Initial implementation of Virtual Typewriter application

An immersive virtual typewriter web application simulating a 1960s mechanical typewriter with:

Core Features:
- Full QWERTY keyboard with animated round glass keys and chrome bezels
- Typebar mechanism animation on each keystroke
- Character imperfections \(rotation, offset, ink density variations\)
- Carriage system with animated movement and manual return
- Margin bell warning near end of line

Typebar Collision System:
- Jam detection when typing adjacent keys too quickly
- Educational modal explaining QWERTY history
- ESC or click to unjam

Sound System \(Web Audio API\):
- Multiple keystroke variations
- Spacebar, carriage return, margin bell sounds
- Collision sound effects
- Zero-latency preloaded audio

Ink Ribbon System:
- Visual ribbon spools with remaining ink indicator
- Progressive character fading as ink depletes \(~800 chars\)
- Black/red ink toggle
- Click to change ribbon

Paper System:
- Three textures: Standard, Coffee Stained, Yellowed
- Paper curl effect
- Export to PNG via html2canvas
- LocalStorage persistence

Customization:
- Housing colors: Forest Green, Burgundy, Matte Black
- Settings panel via ESC key
- Toggle sound, margin bell, jam simulation

View Modes:
- Full view \(1\): Complete typewriter
- Focus mode \(2\): Paper only
- Desk view \(3\): Zoomed out environment

Session Statistics:
- Characters/words typed
- WPM calculation with historical comparison
- Jam tracking by key pair

Technical Stack:
- Next.js 16 with App Router
- React 19 with TypeScript
- Bun runtime
- Tailwind CSS 4
- Web Audio API
- html2canvas for export

Design based on detailed Figma specifications with colors:
Aged Cream #F2E8C9, Matte Gunmetal #4B5052, Oxidized Brass #8A7C4F,
Forest Green #2A4B3A, Burgundy Leather #6B1E2F

Co-Authored-By: Claude Opus 4.5 <noreply@anthropic.com>
EOF
